question: This actor's iconic trench coat and fedora from the film "Casablanca" have become enduring symbols of classic Hollywood style. He earned his only Academy Award for his role as a cantankerous boat captain in "The African Queen," opposite Katharine Hepburn. His other memorable performances include the cynical private detective Sam Spade in "The Maltese Falcon" and the world-weary Rick Blaine in "Casablanca," solidifying his status as a Hollywood legend. Who is this actor, known for his tough-guy persona and distinctive voice?

This Brazilian crime film, set in the favelas of Rio de Janeiro, follows the intertwined lives of two young men: Rocket, an aspiring photographer, and Zé Pequeno, a ruthless drug dealer. Its non-linear narrative and gritty realism immerse viewers in the harsh realities of life in the favelas. It was co-directed by Fernando Meirelles and Kátia Lund, based on the semi-autobiographical novel of the same name by Paulo Lins. What is the title of this 2002 film, which has been praised for its raw and unflinching portrayal of poverty, violence, and the struggle for survival in a marginalized community?

This animated classic features the voice talents of renowned actors like James Earl Jones, Matthew Broderick, and Jeremy Irons. The film's opening sequence, set to the powerful song "Circle of Life," showcases the breathtaking African savanna and introduces the young lion cub Simba. It features a memorable song, "Hakuna Matata," which promotes a carefree philosophy of "no worries." Its villain, Scar, delivers the chilling line, "Long live the king," before betraying his brother Mufasa. What is the title of this beloved 1994 musical film?

This band holds the record for the most gold and multi-platinum albums by an American group. Their collaboration with Run-DMC on a remake of "Walk This Way" in 1986 bridged the gap between rock and hip-hop, introducing them to a new generation of fans. "I Don't Want to Miss a Thing," from the 1998 film "Armageddon," became their first and only number-one hit on the Billboard Hot 100. Their high-energy live performances and bluesy rock sound, led by the charismatic Steven Tyler and the guitar prowess of Joe Perry, earned them the nickname "The Bad Boys from Boston." What is this band?

This animated masterpiece won the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature in 2003, the first and only hand-drawn and non-English-language film to do so. The main character, Chihiro, must work in a bathhouse for spirits to free her parents who have been turned into pigs. Its iconic characters, like the enigmatic Haku and the mysterious No-Face, have resonated with audiences worldwide. What is the name of this critically acclaimed Japanese animated film directed by Hayao Miyazaki?
